definition: Alai (1959-), ethnic Tibetan Chinese writer, awarded Mao Dun Literature Prize in 2000 for his novel 塵埃落定|尘埃落定[Chen2 ai1 luo4 ding4] "Red Poppies"
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]

prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: On the Literary View of Alai, a Tibetan Writer;
sentences.chinese: 阿來是一位非常重視小說敘事藝術的作家。

sentences.english: Ah Lai is a famous author who attaches great importance to the narrative art in his writings.
sentences.chinese: 阿來是一位非常重視小說敘事藝術的作家。

sentences.english: The block-head on a detective novel seems like the research.
sentences.chinese: 阿來對偵探小說貌似很有研究的樣子。

sentences.english: Definite End is the Tibetan minority writer Alai's first novel.
sentences.chinese: 《塵埃落定》是藏族作家阿來的第一部長篇小說。
